alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 04 at 11:34PM CDT until May 05 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Lincoln County in central Oklahoma... North Central Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... * Until 330 AM CDT. * At 1134 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Shawnee, Chandler, Stroud, Prague, Meeker, Davenport, Johnson, Sparks and Aydelotte. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 170 and 182. Interstate 40 between mile markers 183 and 193. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
